intro: Zosima tragioides, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy cyathium inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered. Zosima tragioides is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
